diseases.name: Type 2 Diabetes
diseases.overview: Type 2 diabetes is a chronic condition that affects the way your body metabolizes sugar (glucose). With type 2 diabetes, your body either resists the effects of insulin — a hormone that regulates the movement of sugar into your cells — or doesn't produce enough insulin to maintain normal glucose levels.
diseases.whenToSeeDoctor: If you notice any possible diabetes symptoms, contact your doctor. The earlier the condition is diagnosed, the sooner treatment can begin. If you've already been diagnosed with diabetes, follow your doctor's instructions for monitoring your blood sugar.
diseases.treatmentAndRemedies: Treatment for type 2 diabetes includes monitoring your blood sugar levels, maintaining a healthy diet, regular exercise, and possibly diabetes medications or insulin therapy. Your doctor will determine the best treatment plan for your specific situation.

diseases.name: Hypertension
diseases.overview: Hypertension, or high blood pressure, is a common condition in which the long-term force of the blood against your artery walls is high enough that it may eventually cause health problems, such as heart disease.
diseases.whenToSeeDoctor: Regular blood pressure readings are important. If your blood pressure is consistently above 130/80 mm Hg, consult your doctor. If you have chest pain, severe headache, difficulty breathing, or irregular heartbeat, seek immediate medical attention.
diseases.treatmentAndRemedies: Treatment includes lifestyle changes such as a healthy diet, regular exercise, and stress management. Medications may be prescribed depending on your blood pressure levels and overall health condition. Regular monitoring and follow-up with your healthcare provider is essential.
